extendedIngredients.name: coconut butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: Â¾ c. coconut butter, slightly melted

extendedIngredients.name: sugar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 packet of Truvia sugar substitute or 1 t. granulate stevia

recipes.title: Double Toasted Coconut Butter Cups
recipes.instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the coconut butter and truvia until smooth.Line a 12 cup mini muffin tin with silicone non-stick liners.Fill the bottom of each mini muffin cups with the coconut butter mixture, filling  full.Place the cups in the freezer for 10 minutes or until hardened.Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.Place the coconut flakes on the baking sheet and bake for 5-6 minutes or until toasted.Let the coconut cool slightly.Place the toasted coconut into a large food processor and process until a silky, smooth butter forms. The mixture should be pretty drippy in texture. This takes about 3-4 minutes.Stir in the maple syrup.Take the cups out of the freezer and top the remaining half of each cup with the toasted coconut butter mixture.Freeze for an additional 10 minutes or until hardened.Serve at room temperature.

steps.step: In a large mixing bowl, combine the coconut butter and truvia until smooth.Line a 12 cup mini muffin tin with silicone non-stick liners.Fill the bottom of each mini muffin cups with the coconut butter mixture, filling  full.
Place the cups in the freezer for 10 minutes or until hardened.Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place the coconut flakes on the baking sheet and bake for 5-6 minutes or until toasted.

Place the toasted coconut into a large food processor and process until a silky, smooth butter forms. The mixture should be pretty drippy in texture. This takes about 3-4 minutes.Stir in the maple syrup.Take the cups out of the freezer and top the remaining half of each cup with the toasted coconut butter mixture.Freeze for an additional 10 minutes or until hardened.
